fields.description:
h3. Problem

Confluence Questions 2.7.21  for Server doesn't appear to have been released yet. As a result, Confluence 7.4 doesn't have a supported version of Questions, currently.

Note, this only applies to Server. Data Center has an updated release of Confluence Questions.
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. Expected Results

_To find a compatible version of Confluence Questions on the marketplace for Confluence 7.4 Server. To be able to install Confluence Questions without notifications that it is Incompatible._
h3. Actual Results

_No compatible version of Confluence Questions is available for Confluence 7.4 Server on Marketplace. Installation works but reports app as Incompatible._ 
h3. Workaround

_(Add a workaround, if available)_
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Confluence Questions shows as incompatible with Confluence 7.4

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PPTX file conversion fails due to timeout after 30 seconds

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page
# Add a large and complex PPTX file
# Save the page
# Preview the file

h3. Expected Results
Able to view file
 !image-2020-05-04-23-24-58-582.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Unable to view file
 !image-2020-05-04-23-25-22-769.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2020-05-04 22:59:33,933 ERROR [conversion-thread-0-internal] [conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable] run Cannot create conversion.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8098/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=720&fromPageId=327683 | url: /rest/tinymce/1/macro/placeholder | traceId: 7ae842ba1b937e54 | userName: admin
com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.ConversionException: Conversion interrupted while generating preview due to timeout (30 seconds).
	at com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.image.SlidesConverter.throwConversionExceptionIfInterrupted(SlidesConverter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.image.SlidesConverter.convertDocDirect(SlidesConverter.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.doWork(JVMConversionRunnable.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable.run(ConversionRunnable.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.run(JVMConversionRunnable.java:22)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Split slides in PPTX file into several PPTX file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not all *required fields* are displayed when creating Jira issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira make the *priority* and *reporter* fields to be *required* along with some other fields
# Go to Confluence
# In a page, highlight a text to create a Jira issue

h3. Expected Results
*priority* and *reporter* are displayed

h3. Actual Results
*priority* and *reporter* are not displayed
 !image-2020-05-04-19-10-43-832.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Modify *priority* and *reporter* fields in Jira. This can be a tedious workaround.
fields.summary: Not all required fields are displayed when creating Jira issue

fields.description:
In Confluence 7.3.0 and higher, it is possible to enable the Edit in Office feature through the UI by following these steps:
 # Heading to *General Configuration* > *Office Connector* 
 # Setting the *Enable Edit in Office for all users (this will disable the Companion app)* option. 

However, the Edit in Office option will only be visible through
 # The Attachment List page 
 **  !attachment list.png|thumbnail! 
 # Through the Office Macros.
#* [Office Word Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-word-macro-375849176.html]
#* [Office Excel Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-excel-macro-375849173.html]
#* [Office PowerPoint Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-powerpoint-macro-375849178.html]

In previous Confluence versions, when the Edit in Office feature was available or enabled, the feature can be accessible in the Preview mode of an attachment. This is no longer the case with the new implementation of Edit in Office, as the Edit button is not visible in this mode in all browsers.
h3. 
h3. The Edit option is not visible in specific browser
*Confluence 7.3.0*
In IE: (The Edit option is visible)
!image.png|thumbnail!
In Chrome and Firefox, the Edit option is not visible:
!Screenshot 2020-05-01 at 10.53.14 PM.png|thumbnail!

!Screenshot 2020-05-01 at 10.53.36 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Confluence 6.13.10*
Only visible in Firefox
 !confluence 6.13.10.png|thumbnail! 

*Confluence 7.4.0*
Not visible in Chrome, Firefox or Edge
 !confluence 7.4.0.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add Edit in Office in the attachment preview mode in all browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the page title exceeds the width of the page, instead of wrapping, it extends past the page body, resulting in the need to scroll horizontally to read it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with a long title, e.g.
 xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
 # Save the page
 # Observe

h3. Expected Results

Title wraps and no need to scroll sideways
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2020-05-01 at 3.31.57 pm.png!
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Long page titles overflow the page body instead of wrapping

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Can't restrict users from modifying their email address.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be a parameter for Admin's, which they can set to restrict end users to modify their email address.
h3. Why This Is Important

Users can provide any email address and the system accepts it. So if restrictions can be set it will be helpful.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Option to disable email Address editing option in the User Profile section for end user.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When previewing a word form document with merged fields, displays the wrong version. However, when the attachment is download and opened, the correct version displays.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a doc using MS word and creating a form/merge field.
 # Upload the word doc to the Confluence page.
 # Preview attachment and observe the document.
 # Download attachment and observe.
Or

# Download a Form from MS word.
# Fill in the form fields.
# upload the document to Confluence.
# edit the form fields. 
# upload the 2nd document to Confluence. 
# preview the 2nd document. 

h3. Expected Results

The preview should render the latest word form version.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence renders the incorrect version, but the correct version is displayed after downloading and opening.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing attachment in preview displays the wrong word doc revision.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After upgrading to Confluence 7, Epic Status label is Unreadable With Jira Issues Macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Confluence 7 with Jira
 # Insert Jira Issues Macro and filter for an Epic.
 # Under Display Options, add Epic Status

h3. Expected Results
Epic Status displays in readable color. Example from Confluence 6.15.10
 !61510_good.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Epic Status displays in unreadable color. Example from Confluence 7.0.5, 7.2.0, 7.4.0
 !705_bad.png|thumbnail! 
 !720_bad.png|thumbnail! 
 !740_bad.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add the following to the Space's stylesheet via *Space Tools > Look and Feel*

{code:none}
a.aui-lozenge.aui-lozenge-current, a.aui-lozenge.aui-lozenge-success, a.aui-lozenge.aui-lozenge-default { color: #fff; }
{code}
fields.summary: After upgrading to Confluence 7, Epic Status label is Unreadable With Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While viewing a page that is a child of another page, if you click the ellipsis to show the full page tree hierarchy the red lock icon that you would use to modify page restrictions disappears.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Space called 'Global Tools Home'
 # Create a Page called 'GTF Internal'
 # Create a Child Page called 'Projects - GTF Internal'
 # Create a Child Page under that called 'Test'
 # Add a viewing and editing restriction on this page
 # Click the ellipsis to expand the page tree
 # Notice the red lock disappears

h3. Expected Results

In this case the expected behavior would be that the red lock continues to appear even after you click the ellipses next to dashboard on top to expand the page hierarchy.
h3. Actual Results

The red lock is not visible.

h3. Workaround
 # *[Recommended approach]* Click the *Ellipsis* button (in the upper-right corner) and select *Restrictions* to view the same Restrictions window, essentially achieving the same outcome.
 # *Refresh* the affected Page so it gets back to the initial state, as the ellipsis symbol in the breadcrumbs section and the padlock icon will get back.
 # Open the *Developer Tools* and use the *Inspect* function to select the padlock area and remove the {{display: none}} property; or find the "page-metadata-banner" element and remove the {{display: none}} property.
 *PS:* The third option is not a viable workaround for most users, as the element will be reset every time the page gets reloaded.
fields.summary: Clicking Ellipsis To Expand Page Hierarchy Causes Restriction Lock Icon To Disappear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When installing Confluence with SQL Server, several WARN messages are logged which do not appear to be accurate and can be ignored.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install Confluence with SQL Server. From the UI, the installation appears to complete without any issues. The logs, however, show several specific WARN messages involving the SPACES, USERS, OS_USER, GROUPS, OS_GROUP tables.
h3. Expected Results

The installation completes without these specific WARN messages.
h3. Actual Results

Within the application logs, the following will be recorded:
{code:java}
2020-04-27 10:51:21,124 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [persistence.hibernate.schema.ConfluenceSchemaCreator] executeAdditionalSql Error executing SQL during schema changes: alter table SPACES alter column LOWERSPACEKEY varchar(255) not null, StatementCallback; uncategorized SQLException for SQL [alter table SPACES alter column LOWERSPACEKEY varchar(255) not null]; SQL state [S0001]; error code [5074]; The index 's_lspacekey_idx' is dependent on column 'LOWERSPACEKEY'.; nested exception is com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The index 's_lspacekey_idx' is dependent on column 'LOWERSPACEKEY'.
 -- url: /setup/setupdbtype.action | traceId: 00ec2055891dbcb1 | userName: anonymous | referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action | action: setupdbtype
{code}
Upon inspection, the _SPACES_ table structure is as expected and the required indices are present.
{code:java}
2020-04-27 10:51:29,291 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [status.service.systeminfo.UsageInfo] getCountForQuery Unable to execute usage info query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users - Invalid object name 'users'.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action | url: /setup/setupdbtype.action | traceId: 00ec2055891dbcb1 | userName: anonymous | action: setupdbtype
2020-04-27 10:51:29,300 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [status.service.systeminfo.UsageInfo] getCountForQuery Unable to execute usage info query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM os_user - Invalid object name 'os_user'.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action | url: /setup/setupdbtype.action | traceId: 00ec2055891dbcb1 | userName: anonymous | action: setupdbtype
2020-04-27 10:51:29,313 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [status.service.systeminfo.UsageInfo] getCountForQuery Unable to execute usage info query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM groups - Invalid object name 'groups'.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action | url: /setup/setupdbtype.action | traceId: 00ec2055891dbcb1 | userName: anonymous | action: setupdbtype
2020-04-27 10:51:29,321 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [status.service.systeminfo.UsageInfo] getCountForQuery Unable to execute usage info query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM os_group - Invalid object name 'os_group'.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action | url: /setup/setupdbtype.action | traceId: 00ec2055891dbcb1 | userName: anonymous | action: setupdbtype
{code}
These are old tables that have fallen out of use and were removed from Confluence starting with version 6.10.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: When installing Confluence with SQL Server inaccurate table warnings are created in logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
+As a+ system admin on Windows
+I want to+ be able to set network interface parameter {{confluence.cluster.interface}} on a fixed way
+So that I can+ not use the name generated by Java and use one that is fixed on Windows instead

h3. Problem Definition
Customers report that the network interface name (for example, _eth0_) changes by itself on Windows, sometimes, on reboot.
That is not a consistent behavior and cannot be reproduced.
In this case, it changed form _eth6_ to _eth7_ and caused Synchrony to fail due to Hazelcast not finding it:
{code}
Hazelcast CANNOT start on this node. No matching network interface found.\nInterface matching must be either disabled or updated in the hazelcast.xml config file.
{code}

More information:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58632235/get-name-of-a-specific-network-interface-in-java
http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8/jdk8/jdk/file/82b276590b85/src/windows/native/java/net/NetworkInterface.c#l172
{quote}
* Windows does not have any standard for device names so we are forced
* to use our own convention which is based on the normal Unix naming
* convention ("lo" for the loopback, eth0, eth1, .. for ethernet devices,
* tr0, tr1, .. for token ring, and so on). This convention gives us
* consistency across multiple Windows editions and also consistency with
* Solaris/Linux device names. Note that we always enumerate in index
* order and this ensures consistent device number across invocations.
*/
{quote}
 
h3. Workaround 

Use the instruction on this kb, whenever that behavior is observed:
[Hazelcast CANNOT start on this node. No matching network interface found.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/hazelcast-cannot-start-on-this-node-no-matching-network-interface-found-646447553.html]
fields.summary: Allow other ways to use confluence.cluster.interface on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Jira Issues Count macro (project with thousands of issues in it) inside another Macro (Char, Info, Note, etc) the page and editing macro settings loads ~30s+, which sometimes is unresponsive or server error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps:
 # Add Info macro to the page.
 # Add Jira Issues Count macro inside Info macro.
 # Edit Info macro and update its title.
 # Update the macro - works fast.
 # Add more Jira Issues Count macros and repeat steps 3-4: it will take more time to update the macro or even it won't be updated at all.

or using the Jira Issues Count macro inside a chart:
 # Add chart macro to the page.
 # Add a table with Jira Issues Count macro inside Info macro. Please choose a project with thousands of issues in it
 # Edit chart macro and update its title.
 # Update the macro - works fast.
 # Add more Jira Issues Count macros and repeat steps 3-4: it will take more time to update the macro or even it won't be updated at all.
 # Try to save and view the page and the page loads so slow

h3. Expected Results

The page should be displayed at a reasonable amount of time and macro settings should be editable
h3. Actual Results

Page loads at a rate of ~30s-1m and macro settings sometimes uneditable
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Macro update takes a lot of time when there are Jira Issues Count macro with plenty of issues which sometimes results in not being able to update it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When events are created in a calendar on personal spaces, the reminder mails are not sent to the other users added to the event, except the one that created the event.
The same does not occur for events created on public spaces.

h3. Environment
* Any Confluence version after 6.13
* Team Calendars installed, any version since 6.0.37

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confluence instance with Team Calendars installed and at least 2 users (for this example *admin* and *u1u1*);
 # Create personal space for each user and add a calendar to each one;
 # Log-in as *admin* and create an event for the near future on his personal space's calendar
 ## Add both users (*admin* and *u1u1*) to the event and set a reminder.
 !adminCal1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Wait for the time the reminder should be sent;
 # Log-in as *u1u1* and create a different event also for the near future and in his own calendar, similar to the one from Step #3;
 !u1u1Cal1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Wait for the time the reminder for this new event should be sent.

h3. Expected Results

Both users receive a reminder mail at the time of both steps #4 and #6

h3. Actual Results

* At the time of step #4 only user *admin* receives a reminder mail;
* At the time of step #6 only user *u1u1* receives a reminder mail;

Note: both users receive a notification mail when added to the event created by the other.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendars: reminder mails are not set to all users for events created in a personal space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Applying restrictions to a draft causes it to show up in the Restricted Pages list of a space. The drafts are listed as pages there, which can be confirmed by clicking on the draft entry, it will load the draft in page view mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit a space
# Click create and don't type anything to the draft
# Apply restrictions using the padlock
# Click close to save the draft
# Visit Space tools > Permissions > Restrictions

h3. Expected Results

Drafts are not listed on that menu.

h3. Actual Results

Drafts are listed as if they were published pages:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-28 at 11.04.04 AM.png|thumbnail! 

If the draft has no title, it is listed as *#webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle)* instead of "Untitled".
 
h3. Notes

This causes confusion as users may think there are corrupted pages on the system, whereas instead, those are just drafts that can have empty titles. Another problem is that this allows an easy "exploit" of the following bug, since clicking on the list item will load the draft as a page with */pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<DRAFTID>*

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57697

This can then lead to other issues since the user can like, comment, and do other actions that aren't supposed to happen with a draft. That creates inconsistencies on the DB side that can cause issues later while trying to manipulate this object.

h3. Workaround

Either remove the restrictions on such empty drafts or delete them using the following API call:

{code}
curl -vvv -S -u <USERNAME>:<PASSWORD> -X DELETE https://<CONFLUENCE-URL>/rest/api/content/<DRAFT-ID>?status=draft | python -mjson.tool
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Synchrony proxy fails to establish WebSocket connections, the handshake process times out.

h3. Environment
* Fresh install of Confluence 6.13.7, Server or Data Center
* No proxy or load balancer, although it can be reproduced with those in place as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit setenv.sh and remove the XHR fallback property or set it to false
# Start Confluence and try to edit a page while watching the Network tab in the dev tools pane.

h3. Expected Results

WebSocket is opened and used in the editor session.

h3. Actual Results

WS request returns a 101 code as expected, but the handshake never finishes:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-27 at 4.55.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This causes a loop where the browser keeps trying to establish the connection if XHR is disabled:

{code}
VM322:540 Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (Transport.handshakeOverXhr: ws connection failed, and cross-origin-long-polling is disabled)
VM322:540 Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (Transport.handshakeOverXhr: ws connection failed, and cross-origin-long-polling is disabled)
VM322:540 Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (Transport.handshakeOverXhr: ws connection failed, and cross-origin-long-polling is disabled)
VM322:540 Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (Transport.handshakeOverXhr: ws connection failed, and cross-origin-long-polling is disabled)
{code}

If XHR is enabled, it switches to this method, which causes WebSockets to never be used in this scenario. Based on the data, it seems that the handshake cannot be completed in time so the request times out.
 
h3. Notes

This is a big problem where the network environment is complex and can't be changed. An easy alternative to those scenarios would be to just allow WS connections through the internal proxy to improve the editing experience while minimizing the changes. With this bug, that is not possible.

One interesting item that showed up during testing is that sometimes it works after several attempts of the browser. That is quite inconsistent and it was not possible to determine a pattern or cause, but the main point is that it never works on the first attempt.

What is interesting is that we see successful messages while checking catalina.out, which also will loop until the WS is actually established:

{code}
org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.startInternal Starting WebSocketConnectionManager
27-Apr-2020 17:16:43.390 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-6] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.openConnection Connecting to WebSocket at ws://127.0.0.1:8091/synchrony/v1/bayeux-sync1
27-Apr-2020 17:16:43.443 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-3] com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl._initiate Initiating Jersey application, version 'Jersey: 1.19.4 05/24/2017 03:20 PM'
27-Apr-2020 17:16:48.270 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.startInternal Starting WebSocketConnectionManager
27-Apr-2020 17:16:48.271 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.openConnection Connecting to WebSocket at ws://127.0.0.1:8091/synchrony/v1/bayeux-sync1
27-Apr-2020 17:16:48.439 INFO [SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor-1] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.onSuccess Successfully connected
27-Apr-2020 17:16:48.447 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-6] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.stop Stopping WebSocketConnectionManager
27-Apr-2020 17:16:53.402 INFO [SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor-1] org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketConnectionManager.onSuccess Successfully connected
{code}
Notice they are separated by 5 seconds, which is the current WS timeout.

h3. Workaround

Configure a reverse proxy or load balancer to connect directly to Synchrony, bypassing the internal proxy.
fields.summary: The internal synchrony-proxy is unable to establish WebSockets

h3. Issue Summary

Inspect page permissions, export not working when alternative separator is selected in IE11.

This issue is intermittent and may only affect a specific version of IE11.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Space Tools -> Inspect permissions, select a user and a page and click 'show' (i.e. [https://domain/plugins/gatekeeper-plugin/space/inspect-permissions.action?key=GF|http://10.217.3.242:8090/plugins/gatekeeper-plugin/space/inspect-permissions.action?key=GF])
 # Click 'Export', select a custom separator or a custom space (custom as in not the default comma + space key, not a custom string)
 # Hit 'Export'

h3. Expected Results

Export dialog is closed, csv file is generated and downloaded
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, dialog still there, csv not generated, no errors in browser console.
h3. Workaround

Use default separator and space setting.

If you find yourself unable to click on the Export button, try clicking on one of the dropdowns again and select an option (it can be same as before). Both Export and Cancel buttons will be clickable after.

fields.description:
We are using v7.2.1 (as at 2020-04-26)

(apology if this has been addressed in later versions already)

When there is no View Restriction, the lock icon is a an unlocked solid grey padlock

When it is Edit restricted it is STILL the same unlocked solid grey padlock

When it is View and Edit restricted it is a locked solid red padlock

 

I propose that this is changed to 
 # When there is no View or Edit Restriction, the lock icon is a an +unlocked black outlined padlock+ i.e. white filled.
 # When it is ONLY View Restricted, no Edit Restricted, it is a locked solid grey padlock, i.e. grey filled
 # When it is ONLY Edit restricted, i.e. everyone can view and a nominated editors,  it is a is a locked +red outlined padlock+ i.e. white filled.
 # When it is View AND Edit Restricted, it is a is a locked +solid red padlock+ i.e. red filled.

That way there is a differentiation between the types of restrictions that have been applied.

The outlined padlock, locked or unlocked, always indicates no View Restrictions.

The solid filled padlock indicates Edit Restrictions

The Page Properties Report has a mandatory "*" requirement for a label.

In the same macro, you can do things like filter by child pages. 

The mandatory nature of the label* requirement seems spurious. Child pages is filtered sufficiently by itself, and there can be a need to see page properties on unlabeled pages, or pages for which the labels are not deterministic or known.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report: Remove Mandatory Label

fields.description:
Hello, I would like an "exclude label(s)" property be added to related labels.

Here's why:

First, I have a situation where templates are marked with a label themselves. This means that all pages instantiated from the template share that label. We'll call them "Cars" and "Planes".

I need to do this, because I have pages that run page properties reports on each type, respectively. So far, so good.

However, the template itself has a related-labels macro in it, so that readers can see which cars and planes are associated with each other. This doesn't work so well, because, since all Cars share a Cars label, they are all implicitly related. That's not so good.

I might also have been able to make the current system work if Related Labels had a "count" option. For example, if I could have said "2," then the template property would have been removed implicitly.
fields.summary: Related Labels: Exclude Label(s)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a link macro has been defined and the display and target names are different(or empty) it is not possible to create inline comments on the words that have been used in the link display name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add random content and for this example make sure to add the words (Background, concepts)
 # Add a link macro(insert link) in the following ways:
 ** use the "Advanced" option and add a link to a non-existing page. Set the link name to "Background concepts".
 ** link to an existing piece of content and alter the link name by adding spaces or additional words
 # Publish the page
 # Select the word "background" in the content that was created in step 2 and try to add an inline comment

h3. Expected Results

The inline comment should be saved
h3. Actual Results

The inline comment is not saved and the following message is displayed:
{quote}We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{quote}
The following error is shown in the browser developer tools:
{noformat}
Request URL: http://localhost:26123/c6123/rest/inlinecomments/1.0/comments
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 412 
{noformat}

{panel:title=Technical observations}
I have observed that a working link looks as follows:
{code:java}
<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="Validating elements and models" /></ac:link>
{code}
whereas a link causing this issue looks like the following two examples:
{code:java}
<ac:link><ri:page ri:space-key="EDD" ri:content-title="Background and concepts" /><ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[Concepts]]></ac:plain-text-link-body></ac:link>

<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="Creating the implementation model" /><ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[creating the implementation model]]></ac:plain-text-link-body></ac:link>
{code}
The _<ac:plain-text-link-body>_ attribute is only added when the link name and actual link reference is not the same.
{panel}

h3. Workaround
 * Use the unlink option on the hyperlink effectively removing the link
 * Ensure the link name and page content name is the same(again you might have to edit and save the affected page for the attribute to be removed)
 * Select more than just the individual words when creating an inline comment
fields.summary: Inline comments not saved due to link macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Historical versions of attachments are considered as dependants to be re-indexed if their page is updated. This will lead to an issue when new contents cannot be indexed timely and the content index is backing up. The system is also hammered by the huge amount of unnecessary readings from the cache (to check if the versions are indexable) and I/O operations (for deleting the Lucene documents of historical versions of attachments).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move a page that contains thousands of versions of attachments.
 # Monitor the journal main_index. It will be updated slowly to keep up with the last journal entry ID in the database.

h3. Expected Results
Only the latest version of attachments on the updated page will be re-indexed.
h3. Actual Results
All Lucene documents of historical versions of attachments are deleted. No new documents for them are added.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Historical versions of attachments are considered as dependants to be re-indexed when their page is updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating a page with a large table might be slow on Confluence if Collaborative Editing is enabled.
This causes frustrated users since sometimes it may take dozens of seconds to save a visually simple page.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance of Confluence.
 #* This was validated on Confluence Server 6.13.10 and 7.3.3.
# Make sure Collaborative Editing is enabled.
# Create a sample Space.
# Create a sample Page and publish it.
# Edit the recently created page, make any simple change to the content and publish it.
 #* You will notice the page is saved pretty quick.
 #* Monitoring the browser requests from the developer tools shows a quick response on the {{PUT}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<pageID>?status=draft}}.
 !har-img-001.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the page again, create a table with 30 columns and 100 rows and publish the new version.
 #* You will notice the page takes more time to be saved.
 #* Monitoring the browser requests from the developer tools shows an increase on the response time related to the {{PUT}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<pageID>?status=draft}}.
 !har-img-002.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the page again, add 30 more rows to the table and publish the page (you may use the attached sample storage format).
 #* You will notice the page takes more time to be saved.
 #* Monitoring the browser requests from the developer tools shows an increase on the response time related to the {{PUT}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<pageID>?status=draft}}.
 !har-img-003.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new sample Page and publish it.
# Edit this page, add plain text content worth of ~700KB (you may use the attached sample storage format) and publish the page.
 #* You will notice the page is saved pretty quick, although there's an increase it isn't as high as it was with the table, although the size of the transferred content is about the same.
 #* Monitoring the browser requests from the developer tools shows a quick response on the {{PUT}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<pageID>?status=draft}}.
 !har-img-006png.png|thumbnail! 
# Disable Collaborative Editing.
# Go to the same page with the large table.
# Edit the page, adding a few lines of plain text and publish the page.
 #* The page is saved pretty fast, taking around the same time as the plain text page.
 #* Monitoring the browser requests from the developer tools shows a quick response on the {{PUT}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<pageID>?status=current}}.
 !har-img-007png.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Saving a page with a _complex_ table is quickly processed by Confluence whether Collaborative Editing is enabled or not.


h3. Actual Results
Saving a page with a _complex_ table takes more time than what happens with plain text pages about the size.
Disabling Collaborative Editing takes less time, showing there's additional complexity on processing the request when Synchrony is in the play.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, other users who do not have access to restricted spaces cannot see if a space with a particular name exists. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability for admins to create _Spaces_ name list that also gets updated dynamically for all users to see.

h3. Why This Is Important
This feature would help managers for intra/inter-departmental collaboration. One such scenario is when they have new spaces created but have a bit of trouble keeping track of what's available, so being able to see and request space access based on their names would be helpful.

h3. Workaround
Admins can create a list from the database and attach it to a Confluence page but it needs manual intervention to keep it up-to-date:
{code:sql}
select spacename from spaces;
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to display dynamic list of space names for every user without giving access to their contents

fields.description:
Currently, the docker image for Confluence does not include fallback fonts Non-ASCII Characters, and as a result, Non-ASCII Characters render as squares when attachments are previewed.

To solve this, additional steps are needed:
 * [Non-ASCII Characters display as square characters in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/non-ascii-characters-display-as-square-characters-in-confluence-317948797.html]
fields.summary: Add the support for Non-ASCII Characters to Confluence docker images

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Updates to very large Team Calendars which used to run faster now take much longer to complete. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # User 1 creates a calendar with an event in it
 # User 2 subscribes to that calendar and logs out
 # User 1 create new event type and create a new event in that event type

After step 3, there is new internal subscription in Subcalendar table which have creator is User 1 (the creator should be User 2)
h3. Identification

Run the following query, if it returns any results then you are subject to this bug:
{code:sql}
select 
 *
 FROM
 "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" as child inner join "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" as parent on child."PARENT_ID" = parent."ID"
 where 
 child."STORE_KEY" = 'com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore' 
 and child."CREATOR" != parent."CREATOR";{code}

h3. Resolution

Upgrade Team Calendars to v6.0.49 or higher
fields.summary: Updates to large Team Calendar runs very slow over time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A gadget URL was added to external gadgets causing the others macro to not render any macros and close without any reason. No logs found in atlassian-confluence.log file to indicate the reason for this issue. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add additional logging or exception to help point to the issue, and error notification to the user. 
h3. Why this is important
Enable admin the ability to diagnosis this issue.
fields.summary: Better logging or user prompts when using external gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence implements log4j 1.x as the logging administration library.
This version has reached its EOL for quite some time as highlighted in [http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/manual.html].

h3. Suggested Solution
Upgrade log4j to version 2.x
log4j 2 is also known to have lots of performance improvements as described in [https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/performance.html]
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like Confluence to use log4j 2

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

HTML Text changes when copied into Code Block
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a page
 * Go to (+) and click on other macro
 * Insert code block macro
 * Enter the text as follows:
{code:java}
<Connector port="8081" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"
connectionTimeout="20000" maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" URIEncoding="UTF-8" />
{code}

 * It changes into following:
{code:java}
<Connector port="8081" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"
connectionTimeout="20000" maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" URIEncoding="UTF-8" />
{code}
The relaxedQueryChars are wrong.

h3. Expected Results

The text should not change in Code Block Macro
h3. Actual Results

The text is changing as soon as you paste it in the Code Block macro

h3. Note
This issue starts happening from Confluence 6.14.0 and not observed in Confluence 6.13.10, likely due to the [Editor Improvement|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-14-release-notes-963655609.html#Confluence6.14ReleaseNotes-Massiveeditorimprovements] that comes with Confluence 7.14.0.
|| Confluence Version || Pasting HTML Entiries Worked? ||
| Confluence 6.13.10 | (/) |
| Confluence 6.14.0 | (x) |
| Confluence 7.10.1 | (x) |

This issue is also related to CONFSERVER-66374 (for HTML macro)

h3. Workaround
h5. Using <Markup>
 * Click on (+) on the page where you want to add the code.
 * Click on <Markup>
 * Enter the text as shown in the screenshot attached for your reference, i.e. by adding the text content under code braces.
 * Click on insert and you would see the characters showing up as expected.
fields.summary: HTML Text changes when copied into Code Block

fields.description:
Hello

I am maintaining company internal FAQs about deployed Atlassian products we run, and it often contains references to official documentation for the specific version we run.

The problem is that URL to Atlassian products differs if version is latest or a previous one.

For instance "Permissions and Restrictions" page for Confluence 7.3 is today:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/permissions-and-restrictions-139557.html
and will probably become:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf73/permissions-and-restrictions-139557.html
when another version will appear,
according to pattern seen for previous Confluence 7.2:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf72/permissions-and-restrictions-982323365.html

Would it be possible to normalize documentation structure and create "/conf73/" even for latest product version, so that links copied as reference do not break with newer version?

I propose that today's "/doc/" path becomes a simple alias to latest product version documentation.

That suggestion also applies to documentation of all others Atlassian products.

Thank you in advance for your understanding
fields.summary: Publish Atlassian products documentation in a "stable" way for external links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading DB to MSSQL 2017 edition and migrating from jTDS driver to use JDBC driver (8.2.0) leads to Synchrony service not running/working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * After migrating from jTDS driver to use JDBC driver (8.2.0), opt to use NTLM authentication (mixed mode authentication) by configuring the datasource connection parameter in the server.xml i.e., by configuring the URL below:

{code:java}
url="jdbc:sqlserver://url:port;databaseName=dbname;integratedSecurity=true;authenticationScheme=NTLM;domain=xyz"
{code}
 * Noticed that the Confluence is working fine, i.e., browsing the pages, viewing attaching, admin related tasks etc
 * Page edits, creating new page or save/publish changes isn't working.
 * In general, Synchrony isn't working, though the UI indicates the service is up and running.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence and Synchrony to work
h3. Actual Results

Synchrony or Page edits/creating new page/save or publish changes doesn't work.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-synchrony.log file:
{noformat}
2020-03-25 21:37:13,020 DEBUG [254:StdOutHandler [/usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-8-hotspot/jre/bin/java]] com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$ScatteredAcquireTask@5b9b1d2f -- Acquisition Attempt Failed!!! Clearing pending acquires. While trying to acquire a needed new resource, we failed to succeed more than the maximum number of allowed acquisition attempts (30). Last acquisition attempt exception: 
2020-03-25 21:37:13,020 DEBUG [254:StdOutHandler [/usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-8-hotspot/jre/bin/java]] com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Login failed for user 'xyz'. ClientConnectionId:69c3f3f2-9ff8-4c71-92a0-b5569c41cfba
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Disable CE/Synchrony
 * Adding/Creating a local SQL account in DB server same as AD account which starts establishing connection with database.
 * [Using-kerberos-integrated-authentication|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/jdbc/using-kerberos-integrated-authentication-to-connect-to-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15]

Please note that we will add if there are any new workarounds are discovered.
fields.summary: Synchrony not working with NTLM authentication

fields.description:
Updating the username in LDAP or in Confluence does not reflect the changes in the UI or in the database when the Personal Space was created before the username changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one user(gviana).
# Create the Personal Space.
#* The SpaceKey will be "~gviana".
# Update the username to "gvianabr".
# Go to the Personal Space of this user.

If you check the "spaces" table, the spacekey will remain "~gviana" and the only option to update it is through an UPDATE statement. 

Confluence should have one option to update the SpaceKey if you are the space's owner.

Suggestion raised from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34386 since that ticket was raised 6 years ago.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The *Backup & Restore* administration page takes care of both [Space Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-space-152036.html] and [Site Restore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-site-152034.html] on the same location.

The only straight differentiator to a site export and a space export is the name of the file, which can be changed while moving it from one place to another.

If, by mistake, the administrator uploads a site export file meaning to perform a space import, there will be no following warning and confirmation before the operations kicks-in and start to delete content from the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be 2 actions to a better solution on the UI:
# Keep both actions separated so there's no mistake on what type of operation the administrator is doing.
# When identifying this is a full site import, provide a warning and a confirmation on the UI before deleting content from the database.
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to get a confirmation before starting a full site import/restore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence 6.5 and newer the JDBC driver was changed from the JTDS driver to the Microsoft SQL Server driver. 

Unfortunately, it looks like the Microsoft JDBC driver does not support domain-based auth when running on Linux. It works on Windows:
* [How to use Windows integrated authentication for Microsoft SQL Server in Confluence 6.5 or newer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-windows-integrated-authentication-for-microsoft-sql-server-in-confluence-6-5-or-newer-961785880.html]

This has led to customers with working JDBC configurations not being able to connect the same way after upgrading to Confluence 6.5+ in Linux

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
# Switch to password-based auth (not fun)
# Go back to the old JTDS driver (not tested and not supported by Atlassian)
fields.summary: Support Active Directory authentication for SQL Server when running on Linux

fields.description:
If you install both the MSI and EXE versions of Companion, you will have 2 versions installed and both can run simultaneously. You will also see both appear in Windows' add/remove programs screen.
h3. Expected behaviour

A potential solution would be to prevent installation of one version when the other is detected to already be installed.
h3. Workaround

Manually uninstall one of them.

fields.description:
Using the Events macro for Team Calendars (disabled by default, enable in the UPM under Team Calendars) there is a 'Send email to attendees' (mail icon) link in the events table that  opens up the local email client and pre-populates the TO field in a new email message with all the attendee email addresses.

By default, the email addresses are separated by commas. This will work with all email clients that conform to the RFC 6068 specifications.

However, Microsoft Outlook defaults it's email client to only recognize semicolons to separate email address. This creates an issue where the user needs to manually change the commas <,> into semicolons <;> in the TO field so that the aforementioned email can be sent.

While users can change their 'list separator character' in the regional settings for their Windows machine to use commas instead, for some groups this isn't possible.

There should be an option in the Events macro settings for the 'Send email to attendees' mailto link to either use semicolons or commas when populating the TO field.
fields.summary: Events macro for Team Calendars 'Send email to attendees' needs a configurable mailto separator option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud is introducing the ability to archive pages. This is currently in beta.  If you import a space, exported from cloud, that contains archived pages, the pages are not visible, because there is no UI to display the archive. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence Cloud, create a space, some pages, then archive some of these pages (... > archive)
 # Export the space to XML
# Import the space into Confluence Server or Confluence Data Center

h3. Expected Results

The pages are available (in the page tree, at the root of the space, in the trash,... somewhere they can be accessed and restored)

h3. Actual Results

The pages are present in the XML export, but are not accessible through the Confluence UI. 

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, restore any pages you want to keep from the Archive before you export the space.
fields.summary: Archived pages are not accessible when you import a space exported from Cloud

fields.description:
The [doco that tells app developers how to do caching in Confluence Server|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/how-do-i-cache-data-in-a-plugin/] explicitly says to use {{CacheManager}} instead of {{CacheFactory}}, because of how the latter is implemented.

The problem is that {{CacheManager}} is annotated as being for internal use only (e.g. because it has a {{shutdown()}} method that should not be invoked by apps), whereas {{CacheFactory}} was originally intended to be used by app developers and is therefore annotated with {{@PublicApi}}.

We should resolve this contradiction to avoid (further) confusion to the ecosystem.

N.B. it's not simply a case of switching the annotations between these two types, because:
* there's existing code that will be made to appear like it's using the wrong API, and
* atlassian-cache is a cross-product library, and it's entirely possible that in the other products, there's no problem with using the {{CacheFactory}}.
fields.summary: Revise ecosystem recommendations about CacheManager vs CacheFactory

fields.description:
Before we can use Jira Issue macro, the Confluence and Jira application must be connected via Application Links. People viewing the page will see the publicly accessible issues from the Jira site. If your Jira site has restricted viewing (that is, people need permission to view issues) then they will need to authenticate before seeing the restricted issues. 

When JSD customers are authenticating themselves, due to the permission issue, they cannot see the issue macro with the error "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error". 

h3. Suggestions

It would be great if issue macro functionalities can be opened to JSD customers without granting Jira application access

fields.description:

Inserting a JIRA issue macro inside a chart on a Confluence page causes the value to not appear on the chart when the page is saved. However, if the page is previewed, the values from the JIRA issue macro is showing correctly on the chart.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Environment: JIRA v8.1.3 and Confluence v6.13.4
 # Insert a Chart Macro on a page
 # Insert a table inside the Chart Macro with two columns and few rows populate it with random values and leave one column empty

h3. Expected Results

Values from the JIRA issue macro should be shown on the chart.
h3. Actual Results

Values do not appear on the chart and only appearing when previewed.
 [^JiraIssueTest.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inserting a JIRA issue macro in a Chart Macro causes value not to be shown on the chart

fields.description:

By default, Confluence admin should have the permission to edit and view all pages in Confluence regardless if they have the space permission or not. However, If Confluence admin does not have the view/edit space permission, the edit button is missing for the Confluence admin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and page
# Configure the space to make only {{confluence-users}} group have the edit and view space permission
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new admin user account and add the account to {{confluence-administrator}} group only
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
# Login as the newly created admin account
# Access any page in the space created in step 1

h3. Expected Results
The admin account should see the edit button and edit the page

h3. Actual Results
The edit button is missing for the admin
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to grant the edit permission for the Confluence admin group.

fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html#RunningConfluenceOverSSLorHTTPS-serverconfig]
 When using a self-signed certificate, it's necessary to also put the cert in the JAVA trust store as well as the tomcat Keystore. We should add something along the lines of:
 Add self-signed cert to Confluence JAVA Keystore:
{code:java}
$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/security/cacerts/keytool -import -alias cert -keystore $JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/security/cacerts -file public.crt
{code}
Not doing so can break gadgets and applinks from other applications.

As well the gadget titles per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/internal-gadgets-displaying-titles-as-__msg-935392222.html]
fields.summary: Update SSL documentation for Confluence in regard to Self-Signed Certificates

fields.description:
Allow admins to setup accounts with the ability look and review admin sections in Read-Only mode.

 

Given the need to SRE, Engineering functions to review data allowing a Read-Only Admin profile will help teams in a big way,
fields.summary: Ability to setup Accounts with Read-Only Privileges for Admin Sections

fields.description:
When hovering over a coloured cell in a table, a text appears on screen "background-color="Color"".

Looking at the code in the browser using inspect element, we can see a title is added to the cell when it is highlighted (see screenshot)
h3. Steps to Reproduce 
 # Create a table in a page
 # Highlight a cell and colour it blue for example using the *page editor* 
 # Save the page and preview the page
 # When hovering over the coloured cell, it shows *background colour : Blue*

h3. Expected Results

There shouldn't be any title showing when hovering over a coloured cell
h3. Actual Results

a title is added to table cells when applying a colour and showing in the browser when hovering over a cell
fields.summary: Hovering over a coloured cell in a table shows "background colour : x" in the browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Space administration sections that'd allow a space admin to edit permissions, look and feel and blueprint/templates from the Mobile App.
 Use case: while creating/editing a page I might need to mention users to add content related to their work status. 
 After creating this page I need to see current page restrictions (as well as restrict my page visibility) to other users.
h3. Workaround

Create/edit pages in the browser.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have space administration capabilities in the Confluence Serve Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence Server Mobile App current version does not allow users to rely on macros when creating/editing pages.
Users can use only plain text, which hinders the user experience in collaborating.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement macro browser usage for the Mobile App.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create/edit pages in the browser.
fields.summary: As a user I want to leverage macro browser and include macros when creating/editing pages in Confluence Server Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Zooming out on a page containing panel macros with embedded links or images render with a scroll bar but others don't . This is only reproducible on Chrome. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Chrome browser. 
# Create a page.
# Add multiple panel macros.
# Insert a link or image in all the macros and update the page. 
# Zoom out. 

h3. Expected Results
All panels should exhibit the same behavior. Either all display with a scroll bar or not. 
h3. Actual Results
Some panels render with scroll bar and others do not. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-09 at 3.39.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Use FireFox or IE. 

Tested on Link and Windows 
Chrome 80.0.3987.149
fields.summary: Zooming out on a page causes panel macros with embedded links or attachments t to render inconsistent behavior.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any users or groups with uppercase characters in the username/groupname are not shown as having permissions in the inspect permissions feature. Note that such usernames and group names can only be created using external directories.

The error happens on initially loading the data at start-up, so any groups or users added during testing without a restart are ok until the cache reinitialisation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

When we add a group (Group1) from an external directory and give it permission to view a space, it works fine. It shows up in the inspect permissions table with an upper case G, and respects permissions updates.
 # When we do something that triggers a cache reinit (eg, re-ordering user directories), Group1 now shows up in the table as group1 with a lower case g and no longer respects permission updates. 
 # Try to give group1 permission to view a space and it doesn't show up in the table.

h3. Expected Results

Permissions can be updated as per usual.
h3. Actual Results

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Permission update is not reflected
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inspect permissions shows incorrect results for mixed-case groups or users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Confluence is integrated with Crowd using SSO, Conlfuence does not respect the session timeout configuration from Crowd and seems to update around every 2mins. If you are only logged into Jira and/or Crowd the timeout works as expected. If you are logged into Conlfuence along with any orther application then the timeout no longer works for any application.
 Setting the inteneral Confluence timeout in the web.xml also has no effect. It appears to be related to the *Confluence Quick Reload plugin*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce (Affects multiple verions)
 # Install from scratch Crowd 3.4.0 or 3.70 - likely to affect more versions
 # Install Conlfuence 6.14.2, 7.1.1 or 7.01 - likely to affect more versions
 # Install Jira 7/8+
 # Create an application within Crowd for Jira and Confluence
 # Add a test user and groups to an internal Crowd directory
 # Add your internal Crowd directory to your Crowd applications (Jira/Confluence)
 # Set the Crowd session timeout to *5 min*
 # Configure the external Crowd user directories in both Confluence and Jira under *User Directories*
 # Update *seraph.config.xml* and *crowd.properties* in each application under *<CONFLUENCE INSTALL>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes* & *<JIRA INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes*
 ## Leave session validation at 2mins
 # Open a different browser and log in as the test user to Jira and minimise
 # Wait 7mins (session timeout + session validation interval)
 # Navigate or refresh Jira - notice you are logged out of Jira
 # Still using the same browser log into Confluence and open Jira to, then minimise the browser
 # Wait 7m as above and notice you can refresh or navigate in either Jira or Confluence.

 * Updated Conlfuence web.xml set timeout to 10m <session-timeout>10</session-timeout> which still has no affect

h3. Expected Results

All applications respect the session timeout configured within Crowd and automatically logout within the timeout + session validation interval.
h3. Actual Results
 * If logged into Confluence the session timeout no longer works for Jira or Crowd and most likely any other integrated SSO app.

 * There is nothing immediately of note in the logs, debugging and/or SQL loggin on both Crowd and Confluence plus HAR files. Nothing out of the ordinary.
 * It does seem to be related to the *Confluence Quick Reload Plugin* and/or the *In-App notifications*.
 * You will be logged +_eventually_+ but it has not relation to the session timeout configured either in Crowd or Confluence.

{panel:title=Session test timelines}
Jira
 11:22 - logged in and minimized
 11:28 - maximized and refreshed - session logged off

Confluence
 11:29 - logged in and minimized
 11:38 - maximized and refreshed - session still there
 ---(testing web.xml setting)
 11:40 - refreshed and minimized
 11:54 - maximized and refreshed - session still there
 12:21 - maximized and refreshed - session logged off
{panel}
The customer noticed the following requests which may play a role, many of these requests are made - but only around every 2mins is the session updated within Crowd, whether that is related or not.
{code:java}
/rest/mywork/latest/status/notification/count?_=
(Confluence In-app Notifications)

/rest/quickreload/latest/0?since=
(Confluence Quick Reload Plugin){code}
h4. Notes

So in Confluence case, both, Crowd and internal timeout on web.xml file were ignored
 Jira continues to work as expected so does Crowd as long as you are not logged into Confluence.
 Disabling Confluence Quick Reload Plugin results in working Crowd timeout

Whilst this seems Confluence related switching from database vs memory for token storage had no affect either from Crowd.
h3. Workaround
 # Disable "*Confluence Quick Reload Plugin*".
 # [Disable In-App notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-workbox-notifications-301663830.html]: "Does not provide in-app notifications".
 ## Alternatively, you can set the active polling interval greater than the session timeout.

{panel}
These can be disabled from the Universal Plugin Manager (UPM):
 * Go to >  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png! *> Manage Apps >* Filter on *System Installed > Disable as required*
 Or set your polling interval greater than the session timeout.{panel}
fields.summary: Crowd session timeouts with SSO are ignored by Confluence which also breaks the timeout for other integrated apps

fields.description:
Customer using [Language Macros for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/28648/language-macros-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] to provide different language for the specific page based on the profile setting. This macro also works well when the language profile is passed via an extra parameter in the URL like the following:
{code:java}
<base-url>/pages/viewpage.action?pageid=216868075&showLanguage=ko_KR
{code}
!full-kr.png|thumbnail!   

But the above does not working with *Tiny Link* as it does not pass the extra parameter like the following.

!tiny-kr.png|thumbnail!

The customer wants to have the Tiny Link allow to pass the extra parameter, so it can be used the same as the full URL.
fields.summary: Tiny Link does not pass the extra parameter

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a user becomes inactive, they aren't removed from the calendar event's they're subscribed to. As a result, when attempting to import the .ics file from the calendar into Outlook, we run into errors regarding the events that have inactive users as an attendee. See below error message:

!outlook-error.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

We suggest that the subscription for inactive users to events be automatically removed. 
h3. Why This Is Important

This would ease use of the .ics export feature for users importing their calendars into Outlook
fields.summary: Automatically remove event subscriptions for inactive users from Team calender's

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Similar to the following closed issue: CONFSERVER-43561: Epic Link column in Confluence's "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" is not displayed properly (fixed in Confluence Server 7.0.4)

Jira issue filter does not show the Epic link and name if the page was directly accessed prior to being authenticated. This is specific to each individual Jira issue filter and different filters are not affected across separate pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Pre-requisites:
 * Confluence and Jira have an Application Link established and working.
 ** Versions tested:
 *** Confluence 7.1.2, 7.2.2, 7.3.3
 *** Jira 7.13.4, 8.3.4
 * In Jira, there is at least one existing issue which is linked to an Epic in the same project.

Steps:
 # Create a new page in Confluence and write a title
 # Insert "JIRA Issue/Filter"
 # Write a filter to grab all the issues from project FLP
 # Open the "Display Options" and edit the columns to be shown:
 ** Key
 ** Summary
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Name
 # Click "Insert" and save the Confluence Page...
 # Restart Confluence
 # Access the page using the direct link(Example: http(s)://[hostname]:[port]/display/TEST/Jira+issues+2)
 # Authenticate to the page to view the filter
 # The Jira issue filter does not show the Epic link and name. It also is not hyperlinked. 

h3. Expected Results
 # The epic link should be a link in Confluence
 # The epic link should also show the name of the Epic, to conform to what is seen in Jira
 # The epic link should also be color-coded, as in Jira.

h3. Actual Results
 # The Epic Link is *not a link* in Confluence. The field name implies that it should be a link to the Epic.
 # The Epic Link in Jira shows the Epic name, while in Confluence it shows the Key of the corresponding issue
 # The Epic Link in Confluence is not color-coded as it is in Jira.

The following image shows the differences:

!image-2020-04-07-21-56-15-809.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Restarting Confluence and accessing the page after authentication appears to correct the behavior. 
(this workaround doesn’t work 100% of times, sometimes it shows correct value and later shows the same behavior)
fields.summary: Viewing Jira issues filter does not show Epic link and name

fields.description:
Request to have Confluence support an active-active backup model where one site running Confluence can have a separate site mirrored that would be made primary in the case the normal primary site was offline. 

This is separate from a cold-standby backup model in that the active-active model would have both sites running the entire time, with only 1 being the primary that users would be logged into.
fields.summary: Active-Active backup support for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When BaseURL of Confluence is changed, the *Clustering* page breaks

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence v7.3.4
# Set it up and navigate to *General Configuration* > *Clustering*
# The page will be looking fine (/)
# Add context path in *server.xml* 
# Update the Base URL to include the context path

h3. Expected Results

Clustering page should work fine.

h3. Actual Results

The stylesheet it broken and we see page like follows,
 !css-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes

The BaseURL isn't updated for this page and URL used to fetch stylesheet is the old one,
{code}
        "startedDateTime": "2020-04-06T06:00:52.449Z",
        "time": 90.82099999068305,
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:6734/s/d8f10b5367786022f8f61936adfb5444-CDN/4lraic/8401/8bdd16590a0c0fc5d34174e473e9e416406419a7/f7aa27989185a2913af3ffe1c3ead0af/_/download/contextbatch/css/_super/batch.css",
          "httpVersion": "HTTP/1.1",
          .
          .
      "response": {
          "status": 404,
{code}

Here {{http://localhost:6734}} is the old BaseURL, it should be {{http://localhost:6734/c734}} where *c734* is the newly added context path
fields.summary: Changing BaseURL breaks the Clustering configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Companion App 1.0.0 doesn't work with Self Signed SSL Certificate

When Confluence is served behind a Self-Signed SSL Certificate, editing an attachment will not work and there isn't any error message logged in the {{companion.log}} either.
h3. Tested Environment

Confluence 7.3.1
Confluence 7.4.0(EAP)
Companion App 1.0.0
Windows 10
MacOS
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a fresh installation of Confluence
 # Setup Confluence to be serving on HTTPS using a *self-signed certificate* following [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html]
 # Configure the browsing computer to trust the self-signed SSL certificate following the *Workaround* in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/edit-attachment-feature-does-not-work-when-using-self-signed-certificate-964959893.html]
 # Confirm the browsing computer has Companion App v1.0.0 installed and it is running
 # Attach an attachment in Confluence Page
 # Edit the attachment using Companion App

h3. Expected Results

Companion App should work as expected, allowing the user to edit the attachment locally
h3. Actual Results
 # The browser pop-up requesting to launch Companion App is shown (/)
!Firefox Pop-up.png|thumbnail! !Chrome Pop-up.png|thumbnail!
 # Companion would ask for trusting the domain if it is the first time accessing to the Confluence (/)
 # Browser's connection to Companion App timed out and display the message dialog for Companion App download (x)
!Timeout.png|thumbnail!
 # There isn't any error message logged in the {{companion.log}} (x)
{code:java|title=Example log recorded in companion.log}
info:	adc:file-manifest 2020-04-06T01:20:13.874Z Launching custom protocol for Window. With args:["C:\\Users\\Damien\\AppData\\Local\\atlassian-desktop-companion\\app-1.0.0\\Atlassian Companion.exe","--allow-file-access-from-files","--original-process-start-time=13230609612993731","atlassian-companion:%7B%22link%22:%22https://localhost:2740/rest/token-auth/api/previews/templinksresource/companion/attachment?attachmentId=2064386&jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..1Gre2Y1jzO2n4c8XI9PwpSCpPtW36VySSNcFUVZRKk0%22%7D"]

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Disabling 3rd party apps on startup is a great functionality to troubleshoot issues caused by installed Apps (aka Plugins, Addons).

This functionality is available in the Server deployment by using the {{--disable-all-addons}} attribute as described in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/start-and-stop-confluence-838416264.html].

If we try to use the same functionality in a Data Center instance it won't work and we get the following message in {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code:java}
2020-04-03 12:14:08,659 WARN [Catalina-utility-1]
[atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultSafeModeManager]
<init> Add-ons disable options from '--disable-all-addons' are being ignored due to start up in clustered mode!
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

Since Apps' state is mapped in the database, Confluence could check if the cluster is being initiated (one node only running) and accept the option to disable 3rd Party Apps.
h3. Workaround

As workaround, you may disable each App from the database following the instructions in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-remove-malfunctioning-add-ons-113705118.html].
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to disable all 3rd Party Apps on startup of a Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
Your Companion application is a great tool for editing documents attached to pages in Confluence. However even though there is a significant number of users with Linux as their primary desktop OS you only provide Companion for Windows and MacOS.

There was a suggestion for a Linux version some time ago, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-56399 but this is closed with a Won't fix status. The clossing message in the comments is upright ridicolous. It tells us you will not make a linux version and then suggest that we install Companion for editing douments, which is not available for linux. Not very logical...
fields.summary: We need a linux version of Companion for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Deactivated users are still shown under the Space permissions. If users are to be removed, they need to be deleted under user management. But this totally removes the user from the system.
h3. Suggested Solution

_It will be clearer to the end-user, if the deactivated users are removed from the following locations:_
 # _Under the Space permissions area as they are already deactivated._
 # _Under site restrictions, since no new site permissions will be shared with this user, until they are activated again._

_Once the users are activated, the user names should be populated again under in these two locations._
h3. Why This Is Important

_This will help if deactivated users are reactivated in the future, there is no need to create the users again. Instead, they can just be activated and they will show up under the space permissions area._
h3. Workaround

_NA_
fields.summary: delete space permissions and site restrictions from deactivated users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New templates are featured in the Atlassian product post for Cloud. 
*  [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/confluence/new-templates-for-confluence]
*  [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/templates]

It came to our server customer's attention, and they're looking for these templates. It's not clear the new templates are only for Confluence Cloud. 

h3. Suggestion
Make these new templates available to our server/datacenter customers. I believe it would be a great addition and help a lot of our server customers!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Make the new templates for Confluence cloud available to server and datacenter.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Installing Synchrony DC as a service following the instructions in [Run Synchrony\-standalone as a service on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/run-synchrony-standalone-as-a-service-on-linux-933081078.html] does not automatically bring up Synchrony on reboot.

h3. Environment

This issue has been verified on Ubuntu 18 and AWS EC2.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install a single node Confluence DC on Ubuntu 18 or AWS as a Linux service
# Shutdown Confluence
# Follow the steps in [Run Synchrony\-standalone as a service on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/run-synchrony-standalone-as-a-service-on-linux-933081078.html]
# Remove {{/etc/init.d/confluence}} so Confluence does not start on reboot and also bring up Synchrony
# Reboot the machine

h3. Expected Results

# Synchrony should start up automatically on reboot

h3. Actual Results

# Synchrony does not start up automatically on reboot (x)
# It can however be started up manually using *{{sudo service synchrony start}}*

h3. Workaround

Manually create these symbolic links that Ubuntu's {{update-rc.d}} did not create

{code}
ln -s /etc/init.d/synchrony /etc/rc1.d/K95synchrony
ln -s /etc/init.d/synchrony /etc/rc2.d/K95synchrony
ln -s /etc/init.d/synchrony /etc/rc3.d/S95synchrony
ln -s /etc/init.d/synchrony /etc/rc4.d/K95synchrony
ln -s /etc/init.d/synchrony /etc/rc5.d/S95synchrony
{code}
fields.summary: Synchrony install_synchrony_service.sh does not bring up Synchrony on reboot on Ubuntu / AWS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When disabling Widget Connector and pasting a youtube link into a Confluence page, the link will immediately disappear. It seems the widget connector has to be enabled 

Earlier versions of Confluence such as v 5.10.9 Individual modules could be disabled in the Confluence Paste to prevent auto converting to the Widget Connector using the steps from [How to Turn Off Autoconvert|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-turn-off-autoconvert-269981212.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # disable widget connector 
 # Insert youtube link into a confluence page 

To disable auto converter, (which resolves this in older versions) in a newer version of Confluence the following steps can be used: 

to force disable the auto covert widget connector from Confluence Paste, spin up a version of Confluence (5.10.9) that allows for disabling the modules for Confluence Paste and getting the output from this query:

{code:sql|borderStyle=solid}
select BANDANAVALUE from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'plugin.manager.state.Map';
{code}

Take this output and put into a newer instance such as 7.2.1 instance with the following query:
{code}
UPDATE BANDANA
SET BANDANAVALUE = '<map>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-software-blueprints:jira-sprints-item</string>
    <boolean>true</boolean>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-paste:autoconvert-widget-connector</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>'
WHERE BANDANAKEY = 'plugin.manager.state.Map';
{code}

Restart confluence and cleared the plugins cache and this forced disabled that module. 

h3. Expected Results
Link should stay on the page

h3. Actual Results
Link immediately disappears


h3. Workaround
In the later version of Confluence (tested on Confluence 7.4.0), even disabling the {{*com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-paste*}} from the {{BANDANA}} database table will still have the pasted link disappear immediately.
However, the *Undo* (eg: CTRL+Z) function will be able to bring the disappeared link into the editor
fields.summary: When disabling Widget Connector and pasting a youtube link into a Confluence page, the link will immediately disappear.

fields.description:

fields.summary: Unpublished Changes message does not appear when modifying tasks in task lists when Collaborative Editing is ON

fields.description:
Currently, information about which Tomcat version is included with each Confluence release is not easily available. Such information is useful when planning a Confluence upgrade, for example, to get around Tomcat vulnerabilities on specific versions.

A current possible workaround would be to download the archive release of a Confluence version and check which Tomcat version is included, but as this can be time consuming when checking different versions, making this information more readily available would be an improvement.
fields.summary: Document Tomcat versions for different Confluence releases

fields.description:
The current Confluence Server Mobile Apps does not provide direct shortcut to access Blog Post in each Space. Users need to access the *Recents* tab to quickly find the recently viewed pages, blog post etc. 
* [Using the Confluence Server mobile app|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-the-confluence-server-mobile-app-947169252.html]

Users need to search for new blogpost to be able to view them in the mobile app.
fields.summary: Blog Post Shortcut for Confluence Server Mobile Apps

fields.description:
Problem Definition
As of now, should a user is disabled in Confluence, no indicator would be shown in the Confluence UI itself except under Confluence Administrator Console >> Users page.

Suggested Solution
In JIRA, disabled users will continue to appear on the JIRA user interface with '(Inactive)' displayed after their name, where applicable.
This feature would be preferable in Confluence as well.
fields.summary: Show Inactive user indicator in Confluence UI
